perturbation.original_text: The Affiliate shall indicate on its Web site that (i) the Affiliate is acting as an independent partner of the respective Software Publisher by participation in the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 and (ii) The Software Publisher is the seller of the product and the payment process is administered by element 5.
perturbation.changed_text: The Affiliate should make reasonable efforts to indicate on its Web site that (i) the Affiliate is acting as an independent partner of the respective Software Publisher and (ii) The Software Publisher is the seller of the product and the payment process is administered by element 5.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall' with 'should make reasonable efforts' introduces ambiguity and makes the obligation discretionary rather than mandatory. This vague language undermines the clarity required for compliance, potentially misleading consumers about the affiliate relationship.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) guidelines on affiliate marketing, which require clear and conspicuous disclosure of affiliate relationships to consumers.

perturbation.original_text: element 5 RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MODIFY AND TO SUPPLEMENT THESE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS AT ANY TIME. THE CURRENT VERSION WILL BE MAINTAINED FOR VIEWING AS A HYPERLINK ON element 5's WEB SITE IN THE CONTROL PANEL. MOREOVER, element 5 WILL ANNOUNNOUNCE ANY CHANGES TO THESE TERMS VIA E- MAIL. WHITHIN 14 DAYS OF THE ANNOUNCEMENT OF CHANGED PARTICIPATION TERMS, AFFILIATE AND SOFTWARE PUBLISHER MAY OBJECT TO SUCH CHANGES. IF NO OBJECTION IS RECEIVED DURING THIS TIME, THE PARTICIPANT IS DEEMED TO HAVE ACCEPTED THE CHANGES AND THEY WILL BECOME PART OF THE EXISTING RELATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: element 5 RESERVES THE RIGHT TO MODIFY AND TO SUPPLEMENT THESE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS AT ANY TIME. element 5 will endeavor to announce any changes to these terms via electronic communication. Affiliate and Software Publisher may, if they choose, object to such changes. If no objection is received, the Participant may be deemed to have accepted the changes.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the explicit requirement to maintain the current version of the terms and conditions for viewing as a hyperlink and watering down the email announcement to 'endeavor' creates ambiguity about how and when affiliates will be informed of changes. Changing 'within 14 days ... may object' to 'if they choose, object' eliminates the mandatory timeline to receive notice, which severely degrades the affiliates' ability to stay in compliance. Replacing 'is deemed' with 'may be deemed' weakens the acceptance process, leaving its definitiveness open to interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles of providing clear and reasonable notice of changes to contract terms, as well as principles of good faith and fair dealing, which are implied into contracts and require parties to act honestly and fairly in their dealings.

perturbation.original_text: The Affiliate guarantees in particular that (i) It will integrate advertising Material according to the provisions and instructions of the Software Publisher into that Affiliate's Web site insofar as said Material was transferred to the Affiliate; (ii) The material used the Affiliate's Web site will not contain any representations of violence, sexually related contents or discriminatory statements or representations with regard to race, sex, religion, nationality, handicap, sexual preference and orientation, or age, nor will said Material be unlawful in any way; (iii) The Material used on the Affiliate's homepage will not infringe upon the rights of third parties, particularly patents, copyrights, trademarks or other commercial protection rights as well as general personality rights and cannot be mistaken for the products of the Software Publisher and/or element 5 or a Web site operated by the Software Publisher and/or element 5; (iv) It will not send any e-mail without the express consent of the receiver(s) (no spam e-mails).
perturbation.changed_text: The Affiliate represents that (i) It will attempt to integrate advertising Material consistent with the general spirit of provisions and instructions of the Software Publisher into that Affiliate's Web site; (ii) The material used the Affiliate's Web site will ideally not contain any patently offensive representations; (iii) The Material used on the Affiliate's homepage will not knowingly infringe upon the rights of third parties; (iv) It will try not to send any e-mail without some form of consent of the receiver(s).
perturbation.explanation: Weakening the guarantees by replacing 'guarantees' with 'represents', 'will' with 'will attempt' and 'will ideally not contain' significantly lowers the standard of compliance. Replacing 'according to the provisions and instructions' with 'consistent with the general spirit of' grants more discretion to the affiliate. Adding 'patently offensive' creates a subjective threshold for unsuitable content. Replacing 'will not knowingly infringe' with 'will try not to send' provides less accountability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Lanham Act (15 U.S. Code ยง 1125) regarding trademark infringement and false advertising. By weakening the guarantees against infringement and deceptive practices, the modified clause potentially exposes element 5 to liability for the actions of its affiliates.
